page.title: 11Public House and its cellar
page.content: The popular public house standing on the edge of Thorpe Mandeville and on the side of the B4525 is called The Three Connies (Rabbits). The homely atmosphere provides a place for locals and travellers alike to stop,chat and enjoy a drink. The cellar below the bars has an arched ceiling and smells of damp and beer.The draymen from Hook Norton Brewary deliver their famous Â£real ale' by lorry once a week. The is contained in steel barrels which are rolled down a shute from the yard.The barrels are connected to the bar by hoses,and the beer is forced up by gas pressure.Other beers served are Guiness and Lager.The cllar also houses red and white wine and champagne.These bottles lay on their side to prevent the cork from drying out.They are drunk by people eating in the pub's restaurant.
